title: Complexity of frequency fluctuations and the interpretive style in the bass viola da gamba
author: Igor Lugo (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México), Martha G. Alatriste-Contreras (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México), Rafael Sánchez-Guevara (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México), ...
relevance_why: The paper explores frequency fluctuations in music, potentially useful for improving audio processing and analysis techniques relevant to Haohe's work in speech and music.
background: This study models audio signals of musical performances as complex networks to analyze the relationship between frequency fluctuations and decipher the interpretative style of musicians.
contribution: This paper introduces a complex network approach for analyzing frequency fluctuations in music to characterize interpretative styles based on musician performances.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on traditional music notation or focused narrowly on specific aspects of audio analysis.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages a complex network perspective and statistical analysis to reveal emergent patterns in musical performances using spectral decomposition.

key_innovation: The unique integration of audio signal processing with complex network theory allows for nuanced insights into musical interpretive styles through statistical regularities.
real_world_impact: The findings can inform audio processing technologies and enhance algorithmic music generation, potentially aiding musicians in interpreting and reproducing complex styles.
limitations: The study is limited by the reliance on a specific set of audio recordings, which may not be representative of broader musical practices.

new_terms.complex network: **Complex network** refers to a mathematical representation where nodes represent values (like sound frequencies) and edges represent relationships between them, helping analyze their interactions.
new_terms.spectral decomposition: **Spectral decomposition** is the process of breaking down a signal into its constituent frequencies to analyze its frequency content.

open_sourcing: The database and code will be available in the project name [The complexity of frequency fluctuations in music](https://osf.io/x2qat/?view_only=2ab85b52307b43388da4b52212f2598f), Open Science Framework.
